publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2101# Mr Gil Paterson: James Wilson, John Baird and Andrew Hardie—That the Parliament recognises the sacrifice of the three 1820 martyrs, James Wilson from Strathaven and John Baird and Andrew Hardie from Glasgow, who were hung and beheaded in the 1820 rising to fight for social and economic justice, workers’ rights and an independent Scottish parliament and believes that the history of their struggle should be included in the education curriculum in order to mark the anniversaries, on 30 August and 3 September, of their sacrifice for Scottish rights 181 years ago.
S1M-2101# James Wilson, John Baird and Andrew Hardie (lodged on 6 August 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Linda Fabiani*

S1M-2101# Mr Gil Paterson: James Wilson, John Baird and Andrew Hardie—That the Parliament recognises the sacrifice of the three 1820 martyrs, James Wilson from Strathaven and John Baird and Andrew Hardie from Glasgow, who were hanged and beheaded in the 1820 rising which fought for social and economic justice, workers’ rights and an independent Scottish parliament and believes that the history of their struggle should be included in the education curriculum in order to mark the anniversaries, on 30 August and 3 September, of their sacrifice for Scottish rights 181 years ago. Supported by: Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Brian Adam, Fiona Hyslop, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson*, Dennis Canavan*
S1M-2101# James Wilson, John Baird and Andrew Hardie (lodged on 6 August 2001) Shona Robison*
S1M-2101# James Wilson, John Baird and Andrew Hardie (lodged on 6 August 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-2101# James Wilson, John Baird and Andrew Hardie (lodged on 6 August 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Ms Sandra White*
